metadata.title: CVE-2021-29662 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - negligible
metadata.description:
The Data::Validate::IP module through 0.29 for Perl does not properlyconsider extraneous zero characters at the beginning of an IP addressstring, which (in some situations) allows attackers to bypass accesscontrol that is based on IP addresses.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29662` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libdata-validate-ip-perl - 0.30-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libdata-validate-ip-perl package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.30-1').
